intro: Duroia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam devil's ivy, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
